title: Allosteric Repulsion Learning Model-Based Education for Enhancing Chemical Achievement and Lateral Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Experiment-centered education utilizing VR simulation in smartphone-based limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain chemical reaction mechanisms at the molecular level through visual simulations.
Learners can propose at least three non-standard problem-solving strategies for chemistry using lateral thinking.
Learners can perform VR-based chemistry experiment simulations with over 80% accuracy.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
